translation: wytrwały, dbały [formal; showing hard work, care, and attention to detail]
sentence: The government has been assiduous in the fight against inflation.

translation: krzywe [(of legs) bending out at the knees]
sentence: She had bent, slightly bandy legs.

translation: sprzyjający [providing the right conditions for something good to happen or exist]
sentence: A quiet room is a more conducive atmosphere for studying.

translation: łania [the female of animals such as the deer or rabbit]
sentence: The doe is of a light fawn color and has no horns.

translation: rażący [extremely bad in a way that is very noticeable]
sentence: It was an egregious error for a statesman to show such ignorance.
Namely, it is the argument that has been updated towards the end of the previous paragraph which needs especial care.

translation: waśń [an argument that has existed for a long time between two people or groups, causing a lot of anger or violence]
sentence: The mayor has a longstanding feud with the media.
As the evening wore on the dancing got more and more frenzied.

translation: gapić się [informal; to look at something or someone in a stupid or rude way]
sentence: Don't sit there gawking like that - give me a hand!
The sound of his grating voice complaining all day was driving me crazy.

translation: podróżować autostopem [to travel by getting free rides in someone else's vehicle]
zrozumiałość [(of speech and writing) the quality of being possible to understand]
sentence: Foreign accented speech may affect intelligibility.
She was a very placid (= calm and not easily excited) child who slept all night and hardly ever cried.

translation: kalać [formal; to spoil something that is pure or someone's perfect reputation]
sentence: His reputation, he said, had been unfairly sullied by half-truths and innuendos.

translation: nurkować, przeprowadzać nalot [to move very quickly and easily through the air, especially down from a high position in order to attack; to make a sudden attack on a place or group of people in order to surround and catch them]
sentence: The eagle swooped down to snatch a young rabbit.
